page.title: 05CHESTERTON CHURCH
page.content: The church's name is St.Giles church. About nine people come to it.Servces are held every Sunday at 8.30a.m., 11.00a.m. or 6.00pm but at 4.00p.m.in the winter.This church is about 500 years old.The font,the window and the door are 14th century.The new altar is 17th century.The unusual features in the church are the three tombs of the Peyto family.The tombs are 300 to 400 years old. Around the tombs there is writing telling you about the people inside the tombs.The harvest festival is a special festival celebrated in this village.It is held on the first Sunday of October.There are two church wardens.
